t: Keep*pn me safe, my God, for*ld in you I take refuge.
I*pn say to the Lord,*s “You are my Lord; apart*ld from you I have no good thing.”
I*ln say of the holy people who are in the land, “They*ld are the noble ones in whom is all my delight.”
Those*ln who run after other gods will suffer more and more. I*ld will not pour out libations of blood to such gods or*ld take up their names on my lips.
Lord,*spn you alone are my portion and my cup; you*ld make my lot secure.
The*ln boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely*ld I have a delightful inheritance.
I*ln will praise the Lord,*s who counsels me; even*ld at night my heart instructs me.
I*ln keep my eyes always on the Lord.*s With*ld him at my right hand, I will not be shaken.
Therefore*pn my heart is glad and my tongue rejoices; my*ld body also will rest secure,
because*ln you will not abandon me to the realm of the dead, nor*ld will you let your faithful one see decay.
You*ln make known to me the path of life; you*ld will fill me with joy in your presence, with*ld eternal pleasures at your right hand.
